title: Shipping bigwig sets foot on land with WA logistics acquisition
text:
Global shipping giant Mediterranean Shipping Company has snapped up a Western Australia-based logistics player in a sure sign of what’s to come.

Street Talk can reveal MSC, which is one of the world’s biggest shiplines, has acquired Integrated Container Logistics, which offers container transport, warehousing, distribution, packing/unpacking and storage in and around Fremantle Port.

ICL, a big fish in the WA wharf cartage sector, has been acquired by a global shipping giant. AFR

While it’s a small deal for the Switzerland-based MSC, which will bolt the business onto its logistics arm Medlog, it is indicative of such shipline groups’ intention to expand from their on-water roots and into landside logistics.

It’s an interesting move: Wharf cartage is the first step in landside logistics, and ICL is a logical start. It is said to be a top-three player in Western Australia, but not big enough to break the bank.

The bigger question for listed equities investors – and perhaps those with a national view of the sector – is what does it mean for ASX-listed Qube Logistics. It is understood Qube has heard about the deal and is also trying to work out what it means.
description: Global shipping giant Mediterranean Shipping Company has snapped up a WA-based logistics player.
